abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated as
            satisfactory, with project sustainability as likely. Both
            World Bank and Borrower performances are rated satisfactory
            overall: Despite weaknesses in project management, the
            project largely achieved both its physical targets and
            development objectives. Key lessons learned include the
            following: Ownership of the project design at the political,
            bureaucratic, and operational levels is a pre-requisite for
            project success. A conducive policy environment and
            willingmess to learn by doing are equally vital for success.
            Project design should respond to village aspirations for
            high service standards. The state level institutions should
            have the appropriate mandate and functional autonomy to play
            an effective facilitating role. The excessive turnover of
            key project staff has been a serious problem. Changing
            mandates and mindsets of state agencies, capacity building
            of all stakeholders by providing resources, and quality time
            need to be at the core of project design. Capacity building
            should address motivation, team building, and managerial
            issues for project staff. Implementation arrangements and
            procurement procedures should be aligned with community
            empowerment principles in participatory projects.
            Women's active participation improve local ownership
            and quality of implementation. Imaginative approaches have
            to be vigorously implemented to draw women into project activities.
